steps.title: Click on the Start menu on your taskbar.
steps.content: Click on the Start menu on your taskbar. It's normally located at the bottom left corner of the desktop.

steps.title: This opens your computer's Properties panel.
steps.content: This opens your computer's Properties panel. Here you can view some major details about your computer and its hardware and operating system.

steps.title: Open the Start menu again and click Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Start menu again and click Control Panel . Select “Control Panel” to view settings, and customize areas of your computer.

steps.title: Click Find and fix problems under the “System and Security.”
steps.content: Click Find and fix problems under the “System and Security.” It's in the upper-left area of the window.

steps.title: Click the View All link at the top-left.
steps.content: Click the View All link at the top-left. This opens all troubleshooting options for your PC. The options that are provided describe specific problems that your computer can diagnose, if you’re having a problem. Simply double click any of these option, and the troubleshooting wizard will open. For example, you might click on “Network Adapter” to open the troubleshooting wizard for this specific problem. All the troubleshooting wizards run in the exact same way, regardless of what specific problem you are trying to diagnose. The first step in running the troubleshooter is to simply press “Next” at the bottom of the window. This will start the troubleshooting process.

steps.title: Wait while Windows scans your computer for issues.
steps.content: Wait while Windows scans your computer for issues. If for any reason you would like to stop scanning for problems, click on the “Cancel” button at the lower right hand corner of the window.

steps.title: If Windows finds an issue, it will offer a possible solution to the problem.
steps.content: If Windows finds an issue, it will offer a possible solution to the problem. If you have already tried the solution presented, simply click Skip this step , and Windows will offer you another solution, and will eventually end, giving you a report of possible fixes.

steps.title: Click Check to see if the problem is fixed from the window in the previous step.
steps.content: Click Check to see if the problem is fixed from the window in the previous step. Windows will then check for problems again, as it did the first time you ran the wizard. If all goes well, you should see a window displaying that troubleshooting could not find any problems. In this case, you have diagnosed, and treated your computer’s problem, saving time and money in the process!
